text: Just got off the phone with Ken Lawson about improving the state's response to skyrocketing unemployment claims. Ken runs the state Economic Opportunity Dept. He said they are adding servers for on-line applications, hiring new workers and shifting people to answer calls.

Take a look at this helpful tip sheet for some simple steps you can take to ‚Äúcoronavirus-proof‚Äù your home and help protect you and your family.

Just had a great talk with Perce Paxton of Bradenton, who's happy to be home with his wife Peggy after being trapped on the cruise ship Coral Princess for the past month. Perce said a lot anxiety on board, as you can imagine. Welcome home Perce and Peggy!

Spoke with Miami-Dade Mayor Carlos Gimenez last night and he assured me that all six of our neighbors from Bradenton and Sarasota are healthy and have disembarked after being screened from the cruise ship Coral Princess. Not everyone on board was as fortunate, some with COVID-19.

A Bradenton couple on board the Coral Princess ship just emailed me that they are feeling fine and will be allowed off the ship shortly.  Six of my constituents are on board - two couples from Bradenton and two residents from Sarasota.

I just learned that 60 Floridians, including 4 Bradenton residents and 2 from Sarasota, are on board the cruise ship Coral Princess. I‚Äôm working to ensure all my constituents come home. I did the same for constituents on other ships. No Floridian should be left stranded at sea.

Our fellow Floridians on a cruise ship are coming home, including four of my constituents. Those sick will get the treatment they need. This is the right decision and why I urged White House COS Staff Mark Meadows to intervene. We don't leave our neighbors stranded in the ocean.
We need to do everything possible to beat this virus and keep people safe! https://t.co/1NR5oITsIu

Hearing that 49 Floridians stuck on a cruise ship, including four of my constituents, will be coming home. This is the right decision and why I urged White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows to intervene. We don't leave our neighbors stranded in the ocean.

Just got off the phone with White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows about the Floridians trapped on a cruise ship. He said he would call the State Department and work to resolve the matter quickly.

Just talked to the White House about stranded cruise ships with Floridians on board. Told the White House they need to get the Floridians off the ships, back in Florida and into quarantine for treatment if necessary. Told Gov. DeSantis the same. We take care of our people.
